I mean, damn, do we work together as a team or what?! You, on the other hand, seem like a nice guy. How long has it been since                      you left the NYPD?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you resign from the force? You                    were a detective, is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wounded during a holdup... It kind                  of changed my perspective on things.                      Ben and Lorenzo reach the next floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third floor... Ladies' department. You gotta be careful here. When the wind blows, sometimes the tiles fly off the roof and they'll just snap your ear off, if you follow what I'm saying... Lorenzo checks the time on his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll let you get acquainted with the rest of the store on your own. They turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me, I'll show you our "headquarters" and I'll get you one of these uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DUSK
dialogues.text: It's almost night. Ben and Lorenzo have finished their vi exit the department store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were a pretty big team working here                    before the fire. When you stop to                         think that of all the department                          stores in New York, this one was the                      most beautiful, the most luxurious... It                  breaks your heart, it really does...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Outside the building behind the fence blocking its entry, construction trailer has been outfitted for the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go. This is where you'll be spending most of your time. At least you've got electricity in here. It's nice and warm, and there's even a TV.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Cartoons flicker on an old television set. All bundled up coat, and wearing a woolen hat, a young boy is watching T Lorenzo and Ben enter the mobile home-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo Junior, my grandson... Say hello Lorenzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo and I are going to the movies tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo strokes his grandson on the head and proceeds to back of the mobile home, leaving Ben alone with the child boy looks almost hypnotized by the images on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you, Lorenzo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo Jr. shifts his attention from the cartoons and st Ben in the face-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you work in the department store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa says there are ghosts in the store... Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your grandpa just wants to scare you a little.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lorenzo Senior has changed clothes, and returns with a un which he hands over to Ben-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, this should fit you. Lorenzo, put your coat on... We are already late. (to Ben, on the sly) There's a drop of Jack Daniel's in the cupboard... To keep yourself warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo hands over the keys-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Ben, the place is all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to leave when-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I forgot the most important thing... the flashlights! You'll be needing one of these at night. We've got two of them. They run on batteries. Don't forget to charge them... See you in the morning, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo and Lorenzo Jr. exit the trailer. Through the win Ben sees them walk out to the street. Ben inspects the trailer- scattered with knickknacks, the decoration of the place corresponds well with Lorenzo's personality - warmhearted and humble. The clock on the wall shows 7 p.m.... A long night lies a Ben grabs a flashlight and turns it on. The beam of light dazzling-

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The flashlight sweeps across the dark entrance hall. Wearing the security guard's uniform marked with an embro "M", Ben makes his first round of the store. The pigeons perched on the roof seem to observe him. Ben proceeds slowly up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Men's department, Ben's flashlight is a mere lumin spot twirling in the night. The ever-present mirrors magnify the space to infinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks through the different sections of the Ladies' department. He examines the remains of the charred garmen sagging on the hangers. The silhouettes of the burnt mannequins emerge in the glo the night. STRANGE AND DISTURBING SHAPES REFLECT OFF THE MIRRORS.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Wide exterior shot- By night, the department store's ornate facade takes on a entirely different appearance - more menacing, almost evi

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ben continues his rounds. We follow his path through reflections in the mirrors- AS IF HE WAS BEING WATCHED... Then- For the first time, we discover another perspective, anot FROM WITHIN THE MIRRORS. It feels ominous, slightly detac The sound is muted. Ben crosses back the third floor- The second floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the reflection of one of the grand mirrors in the entr hall, we see Ben come down the stairs. He stops for a mom facing his reflection in the mirror. He fixes his collar and looks at himself in his new cloth quite an NYPD uniform... Suddenly, his eyes freeze. Intrigued, he comes closer to mirror and leans forward- A HANDPRINT, BARELY VISIBLE, ON THE ICE COLD SURFACE. He touches it with the tip of his fingers and tries to ru off, unsuccessfully. He picks up a rag from the ground, s the mirror, and rubs the mark fervently. The print remain confirms his hunch- THE HANDPRINT IS INSIDE THE MIRROR... By angling the flashlight, another handprint is revealed. Another. And yet another-

dialogues.speaker: TO GET OUT...
dialogues.text: As he looks back up in the mirror he sees- THE ACCESS DOO THE BASEMENT OPENING... Ben turns around. His gaze freezes- THE ACCESS DOOR TO TH

dialogues.speaker: YET, IN THE MIRROR, IT CONTINUES TO SLOWLY SCREECH OPEN
dialogues.text: Ben swings his head back and forth, between the shut door reality and the opened door in the mirror. What is happen he dreaming or hallucinating? Ben walks backwards towards the basement door, keeping hi fixed on the mirror. As he goes to reach for the handle, his reflection reaching for the handle of an invisible do Ben opens it-

dialogues.speaker: THE SYNCHRONICITY BETWEEN THE REAL WORLD AND THE ONE REFL
dialogues.text: IN THE MIRROR HAS BEEN RESTORED. Ben tries to reenact the phenomenon. He opens and closes the door over and over, w observing his reflection, but the mirror is no longer dec The staircase leading to the basement vanishes into the d Ben hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ben walks down the stairs, step-by-step, lighting his way flashlight. The beam of light dims, the battery is almost He gives it a few taps to make the light reappear. Last step-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few inches of water cover the basement floor. One of th pipes must have burst due to the cold.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The light flickers back for a moment, revealing before hi narrow subterranean corridors of the department store. Along a wall, Ben finds a fuse box and pushes some of the switches. Further down in the corridor, a couple of fluor lights flicker to life- two tiny sources deep inside the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: It's been snowing all day and a white coat of powder outl the trees and houses. On the front lawn of their house, 5 year old MICHAEL and old DAISY are building a snowman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did they say on TV that it wasn't supposed to snow today, but tomorrow instead? Why did they lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes they make mistakes, Michael. It happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grown-ups don't make mistakes. Only little children do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly annoyed, the little boy places the eyes on the s Daisy's face lights up with a big smile when she catches of her father's car approaching-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns around and sees Ben exiting his 1986 Oldsmo with a big wrapped package in his arms. The children abandon their snowman and rush towards their father. Ben takes Michael into his arms-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the wrapped present) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't know, I just found this package hidden behind a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... (to his daughter) Daisy, has Michael been a good boy? Does he deserve his birthday present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Yesterday he finished the whole bag of candy when mom had told him he could only have one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it's true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not true... She's lying Daddy. I've been a very good boy, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is mom back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Rosa came to pick us up from school today.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, ROSA, the nanny, is rinsing the dishes fr afternoon snack-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Rosa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello SeГ±or Carson. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good, very good... What time will Amy be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not before six, Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I'll wait for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to fix you a snack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben takes off his coat and joins the kids in the living r hands over the present to his son. Daisy is sitting in the armchair, holding her cat, TIGER, arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh, open it stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael tears away the wrapping paper and discovers a rem control car. The little boy is on cloud nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front window, we see a Volvo station wagon pa front of the house. Amy gets out of the car, loaded with shopping bags. She enters the house and hands the groceri to Rosa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Rosa... Where are the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs...                                             (in a low voice) ...With SeГ±or Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expression on Amy's face shifts. Noticeably irritated goes up to the second floor. Michael's remote control car drives at full speed down th hallway. Ben shows his children how to operate the remote control while the bathtub fills up. He seems as excited a kids by the new toy. Ben turns around to find Amy watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Amy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Mommy, look what Daddy got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great, you will have to show me                    how it works!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so fast Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, can I talk to you, in private?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben puts down the remote control-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his kids) Ok kids, it's time for your bath. No                    fooling around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben follows Amy into the bedroom. She closes the door beh them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy is not equally pleased to see him- She's beside herse anger-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? I already asked you not to drop by without calling, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, but you never take my calls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your calls in the middle                   of the night. I'm better off without them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had a drink in three months                   but, then again, how would you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know, Ben. I don't want to hear about it. It's not my problem. You're not my problem. You've                  done more than enough harm already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think people can change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not talking about people, we're talking about you. How many times did you tell me you were gonna change and nothing happened? It only got worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben moves closer to his ex-wife-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me another chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles- How many other chances did she already give h Behind the firmness and intransigence she conveys, we sen is torn. She still loves him as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more time, Ben. Listen, I will                     never stop you from seeing your                           children but we have to set up some                       rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of nowhere, Ben hits the wall with his bare fist-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT RULES?! IT'S MY SON'S FUCKING                        BIRTHDAY TODAY! COME ON AMY, WHAT RULE                    IS GOING TO STOP ME FROM SEEING HIM?

dialogues.speaker: INT. EARLY EVENING
dialogues.text: In the bathtub, Daisy and Michael cannot avoid overhearin parents arguing. In denial, Michael blocks his ears with hands and lies back under the water...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE BEDROOM -
dialogues.text: Amy seems distrustful of Ben, scared of how close he is t edge. We can see the anger in his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at yourself. You're still                            carrying around so much of that anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches a glimpse of his reflection in the mirror- and desperate violence in his eyes... Ben steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to calm down)                                 I'm sorry, I didn't mean to yell at                       you... Things could be so different                       between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I know, but it's up to you Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Anyway, I wasn't planning on                    staying. My shift starts in an hour.                    I'll just kiss them goodbye and then                    I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben exits the room. Amy is left alone- Through the window, she watches Ben exit the house and ge his car. When she turns away, she discovers Michael and Daisy stan outside the bathtub dripping wet in their towels. She smi and quickly comes to dry them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Daddy coming back to live with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know sweetheart. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: The beams from the flashlight are reflected in the few in water flooding the basement corridor. Since yesterday, th level has continued to rise. The outline of Ben and Lorenzo's silhouettes appear in th staircase leading to the ground floor-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't managed to find the source of the leak. My guess is it doesn't come from the store... It must be a municipal pipe that blew with the cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call the company tomorrow morning                  and have them come take a look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the gas stove, a kettle is whistling.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben rummages through the cupboards and the drawers. He fi some instant coffee next to the bottle of Jack Daniels. H briefly hesitates between the coffee and the whisky... He grabs a cup and pours the boiling water into the insta coffee. In the reflection of the clock, we see Ben watching TV. I past midnight. Ben gets up and grabs his flashlight- It's for his rounds.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Through the shattered panes of the central dome, we see B walking through the store. Since the mysterious occurrences of the night before, his attitude has changed. He avoids, as much as possible, loo into the mirrors. He is on guard, fearing another superna manifestation. The shadows, the mannequins, and the shapes in the mirror all disturbing and unsettling. Even what remains of the sculptures on the top of the mar columns seems alive in the dark. As he crosses the entrance hall, a glint of light catches attention. Despite himself, he stops and gazes into the m

dialogues.speaker: HAPPENED.
dialogues.text: How is this possible? Ben turns around to see the same sp the real world- ONLY IT'S IN RUINS... Ben glances back at the reflection in the mirror- The vision of the past prevails. Unable to ignore it, Ben decides to check it out for himself... Ben wanders off towards the far end of the store, a lands dust and desolation. HIS REFLECTION IN THE MIRROR, ON THE

dialogues.speaker: HAND, HEADS IN THE DIRECTION OF THE "FLASHBACK"-
dialogues.text: We follow him in the mirror- Ben has left the night behind and enters the "daytime" department. Everything is in perfect order and unspoiled. Ben continues his journey into the past.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The customers jostle one another while shopping during a sale. Children run wild in the aisles. Women fight over a of clothing. Ben stops dead in his tracks when he notices, around his a transparent liquid spilling out on the floor- He bends down and dips his fingertips into the liquid- GA Gallons of flowing gasoline gradually spreading over the of the department store. Ben turns around and sees, under the shelving, A HAND LIG

dialogues.speaker: ZIPPO-
dialogues.text: The lighter falls to the floor in slow motion. The liquid bursts into flame instantly. THE CHEERFUL VISI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened, Ben steps back- The flames spread quickly to the escalators where the cro rushed to escape death-

dialogues.speaker: FACES DISTORTED BY THE PAIN, SKIN MELTING TO THE BONE.
dialogues.text: In the midst of the flames through the heat waves, Ben sp face of the firestarter- IS IT HIS OWN? Ben has no time to react. In a split second, his uniform fire. Panicked, he attempts to put out the fire with his hands-

dialogues.speaker: DELIRIOUSLY AS HE TRIES TO SMOTHER THE INVISIBLE FLAMES.
dialogues.text: He comes back to reality- Ben catches his breath, trying to come to his senses. Wha happening to him? What he just experienced certainly felt During his panic, the flashlight rolled under one of the counters. Ben bends down to pick it up. The beam illuminates the gr and throws light on an object a bit further away- A LEATH WALLET.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stretches out his hand to pick it up. The leather is w but the absence of dust establishes that the wallet has l there recently. Ben examines the object with the experien touch of a professional accustomed to handling evidence. Between the collection of cards and scraps of paper, Ben driver's license belonging to- GARY LEWIS, 55 years old, sturdily built African American man. WE RECOGNIZE THE MAN RUNNING IN THE SUBWAY, AT THE BEGINNING. The name rings a for him-

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ben returns to the trailer and rummages through the close He stops when he finds another uniform. A name is embroid the shoulder-

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT WATCHMAN.
dialogues.text: The wallet rests on the table and piques Ben's curiosity. cannot hold back his police instincts. He finally empties out the contents on the table- A Blockbuster card, restaurant receipts, a driver's licen Phillips' business card from Mayflower, cash and a sheet paper folded in four- Ben unfolds the sheet of paper and sees, written in ink-

dialogues.speaker: ESSEKER
dialogues.text: Ben chews over these seven letters. Is it somebody's name place? A code? Initials? He folds it up again and puts everything back, neatly, in the wallet that he stows away of the drawers.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: A busy street under the subway overpass. We see a neighbo bar on the corner-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this time of day the place is deserted. A plasma scree a baseball game. A drunk guy is half asleep at the corner

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sitting at the bar, Ben is nervous, tense... He removes t steeped tea bag from his cup. Ben stares at himself in the mirror, behind the bottle di shelves. It is not his mirror image that he is observing. gaze seems to pierce through his own reflection, to dive into the very depths of his soul. Angela interrupts, across from him, behind the bar. She w here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued) What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing special...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) Come on, you've been looking at                         yourself for more than half an hour.                    You never used to be so vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't avoid them. They're everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mirrors... In the department                        store, at every street corner, in the                   windows of every fucking building in                    this city. I feel like I'm not the one                  looking into the mirrors, but rather                    they're looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela smiles, not sure if he is serious-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you're being a little                   bit paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben observes the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirrors are just glass and silver,                      Ben...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angela smiles at him and continues to polish the drinking glasses.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the darkness, a rat glides peacefully on the water sur In the basement, the water level continues to rise. With a flashlight in hand, and his feet submerged in the Ben moves deeper into the tunnel. He is searching for the source of the leak. The beam of l sweeps across the walls and the piping. Ben crosses an intersection. In the corner, on the tiled he barely discerns an old inscription ingrained with deca dust and dirt. He sinks his hand into the water and wipes off, revealing an arrow pointing to, ST JOHN'S DEPARTMENT PSYCHIATRY. He continues his exploration of the subterranean passagew Suddenly, he notices a darker area on the wall. He comes and discovers a brownish damp-spot, covered with mold. Th humidity has pearled into droplets. He has found the source of the leak. His hand brushes the wall, causing it to crumble instantl digs into the plaster as if it were butter, bringing a cr water pipe to light. The leakage has damaged the wall in the tubing was embedded. Ben hears the echoing sound of streaming water, as if the another room on the other side of the wall. He pushes against the saturated wall, and pierces through with his arm. He removes his arm. For a moment, he observ gaping black hole that he has just left behind. Ben peeks through the hole with his flashlight, but he ca make out what is on the other side. He makes the hole bigger, until the passage is large enou him to crawl through-

dialogues.speaker: MIRRORS.
dialogues.text: One of the mirrors is opened, ajar- It's a door. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His image is reflected in all directions and from infinit angles. Ben moves towards the center of the room-

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORNER.
dialogues.text: It's a well-built man. He too is wearing the blue securit guard's uniform. From where he stands, Ben can only see the back of the ma head. As he moves in closer, he can make out the name embroidered on the man's shoulder-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouette remains still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes a bit closer. His gaze freezes when he realizes that Gary is not standi front of the mirror with his face pressed against it, but

dialogues.speaker: HE IS BEHIND THE MIRROR, INSIDE
dialogues.text: Ben steps back, terrified. He doesn't know how to interpret this new phenomenon. Ben gathers his courage and returns in front of the mirro Knock, knock, knock... He hits the mirror with his fist, as if it were merely a window behind which Gary Lewis was standing, on the other No reaction. Ben strikes the mirror harder. Knock, knock, knock... The former night watchman turns around slowly towards Ben revealing his face little by little...

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: Knock, knock, knock...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In his bed, Ben wakes up with a jolt- THE ENCOUNTER WITH WAS A DREAM. Knock, knock, knock... Somebody is knocking at his door. Ben gets up from the co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben opens the door to a UPS deliveryman holding out a pac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carson?                                             (Ben nods) Would you mind signing here, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben signs for it and takes the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a nice day, Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben shuts the door and examines the UPS box. He's not use getting many deliveries. He flips it over to see who it i THE SENDER IS GARY LEWIS... Ben grabs a kitchen knife to open the parcel. He tears aw cardboard and empties out the contents onto the living ro table-

dialogues.speaker: A DOZEN NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS LAND, ALL MIXED UP, ON THE TA
dialogues.text: More or less recent, all the articles relate to the depar store and the fire that burned it down... Gary has meticu cut them out and sent them to Ben. But why?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: Ben's car parks in front of the fence that encloses the e to Mayflower. He runs into Lorenzo who exits the trailer, ready to go h from work-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just been through the craziest day here... No kidding! Your ex- colleagues came to pay us a visit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Gary, the guy who was working                    here before you, the cops found him                       dead in a subway station in Harlem. I                     never liked him too much, but poor guy, he didn't deserve to go like                         that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they mention the cause of death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... they wouldn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorenzo hands him over the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Ben? I better get going, Mrs. Sapelli is waiting for me at home. Have a good night at work, Ben. Oh,                       and by the way, about that leak, they're sending someone over to work at it the beginning of next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good night, Lorenzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben remains standing on the landing of the trailer for a his gaze fixed at the department store-

dialogues.text: All of a sudden, Ben realizes something. He runs back to file on the table and goes through the documents again, o one. He stops on a carbon copy of a hospital release form and the date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong Larry, you're wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes light up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she left the hospital on the 4th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the document, Anna left two days before the massacre!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning-

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Through the half-opened door at the end of the hallway, w Daisy brushing her teeth before going to school. The litt is humming as she watches herself in the mirror... Amy comes out of her room-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... Let's go... Daisy, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes in front of the children's room and stops- INS MICHAEL IS TALKING TO SOMEBODY. Amy listens closely, but only hear Michael's voice. On the other side of the door, little boy bursts out in laughter-

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: She opens the door and finds her son squatting in front o mirror, talking to his own reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing Michael? Come on, we're going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little boy does as his mother says.      He gets up a out of the room. Amy's glance freezes in horror. Terrified, she almost los balance-

dialogues.speaker: HE LOOKS AT AMY WITH A BIG SMILE.
dialogues.text: Amy attempts to speak but can't- The mirror image of her son remains silent. Amy steps closer to the mirror and, in the reflection, be the boy, she discovers-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. Ben wakes up in a jolt and picks it up- ON THE OTHER END OF THE LINE, IN TEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy ? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You have to come over... Right away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy cannot get the words out. The convulsive sobs overtak voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so scared, Ben...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something in the house... Something in the mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are Daisy and Michael? Are the kids all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're with me... They're right here with me. Come over, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the house. I'll be right over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben runs to his car and throws the Esseker file on the pa seat. He drives off at full speed and disappears at the f of the road.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. DAY
dialogues.text: On 38th Street, away from the hustle and bustle of Broadw Mayflower facade is unsettling and disturbing.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: When he arrives, Ben finds his wife waiting in front of t house. The kids are playing in the snow. Ben's car pulls the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amy throws herself into his arms, crying with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here, Amy. I'm here now...                      Thank god you're alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comforts her, holding her tightly with all his streng

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stay here, we have to leave                      the house now... We can go to my                          mother's or to a hotel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyplace is gonna have mirrors or windows... Anything you can see your self in is dangerous. We have to make                     the house safe. The only way is to                        cover all the reflections. If we keep                     them in the dark we can avoid them. We                    need paint, we need tape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben has brought up some more paint from the basement. Wit help he paints over all the mirrors in the house. In the this hardship, all the arguments seem far away. We can fe connection between the two of them. The windowpanes and picture frames have been wrapped secu with newspaper and tape. Every inch of reflective surface in the house, such as th screen and the shiny taps, have been "neutralized" with s of masking tape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of the house opens. On the landing of the steps, Ben kisses Daisy goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will you be back, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As quickly as I can, sweetheart. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Michael who hugs him back-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strokes Michael gently on the head and goes to his car and Michael watch their father leave. Amy walks him to the vehicle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you don't find her? Maybe she doesn't live there anymore? Maybe she's really dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want her, I'm gonna find her                      wherever she is. We don't have any                     other choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben holds her tightly in his arms and plants a tender kis her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about everything I've put you through... I didn't want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, I want you to stay here with the                  kids until all this is over. All the mirrors are covered, there's no more danger. I'll come back as soon as I                    can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well up in Amy's eyes. He takes her hand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey baby, everything's gonna be fine. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles tenderly. Ben drives off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: Through the back window, we see Amy in front of the house growing more and more distant. Anna's medical file lies open on the passenger seat- At t of the page we can read her old address in Pennsylvania.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: -Aerial shot- We fly over a lake- the waters are so placid that the for outline of the scenery surrounding it reflect off its sur creating two perfectly symmetrical landscapes. We glide over the treetops, diving deeper into the forest follow the main road that zigzags along the slope of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign on the edge of the road indicates 67 miles to Pennsylvania. Ben focuses on the road, determined to put an end to what behind the mirrors and to rescue his family.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: Ben's car slows down as he reaches a dirt road. On one of the mailboxes standing on the edge of the road spots the name Esseker-

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: The wind blows over the land. In the winter season, the muddy fields have little to off the few starving crows flying over them. A feeling of des and solitude hangs over the deserted landscape. Ben's car has left the asphalt road behind, driving throu countryside down a winding dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An old farmhouse stands at the very end of the path. If i weren't for the parked pick-up truck and the few piglets wild, one would think that the farmhouse was abandoned. Ben gets out of the car and goes to knock on the door. His shoes sink into the mud. He walks up the steps of the and peeks inside the house through the front window. In t he discerns the silhouette of a person who is watching TV can't help but notice all the mirrors have been covered o turned towards the wall. A big dog barks behind the window. Ben steps back, surpri The front door opens before Ben has even made his presenc known. A young man stares at him in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Is this the Esseker farmhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man nods. A woman's voice is heard from inside-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Mom. (to Ben) What can I do for you sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am looking for Anna, Anna Esseker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man looks at Ben questioningly. Apparently he h never heard the name before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his mother inside) There's a man who's looking for... (back to Ben) You said Anna? (Ben confirms) Anna Esseker, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's mother, in her fifties, an obese woman who has tr moving around- shows up in the opening of the door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want with Anna Esseker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches him unaware. Ben makes up a false identity-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I huh... I am doing some research for a book on the history of St. John's Hospital, in New York... Jimmy's mother stares at him for a moment with a suspicio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, go tell grandpa that there's a man here who'd like to talk to him about his sister.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: We are in the dark basement, under the farmhouse. The doo the first floor opens, letting the light in. Ben appears the silhouette of an old man- ROBERT ESSEKER, 80 years ol Anna's elder brother. Robert walks down the steps, signaling Ben to follow him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, up to this day, the visions                     of Anna's fits still haunt me at night.                                                    They walk through the basement towards an old wooden door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I helped my father fix up this part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the basement, especially for her- The old man turns the key in the padlock. Slowly, the doo swings open, revealing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her fits were too violent. My mother couldn't take her screams anymore. What's left of a very primitive child's room, SURROUNDED DOUBLE WIRE FENCING AND IRON BARS. Rather than a cell, it resembles a HUMAN-SIZED CAGE, CAPABLE OF RESISTING THE MO FEROCIOUS BEAST. As he's talking, images flash on screen- painful memories that time come back to him- Anna being carried to the basement, her innocent eyes ful hate. It's even hard to recognize the face of a little gi howling screams. Her nails digging into her own flesh. He unnatural strength and the violent thrashing of her arms legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had every priest, doctor, healer, coming from all over the state, one after the other. But no one could help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes closer to the iron bars of the cage. He can see scratch marks next to the bed, giving his imagination a t her plight and suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Dr. Kane from New York answered my parents' cry for help. He rejected the idea of demonic possession, said he didn't believe in it. He was convinced that Anna suffered from a rare form of personality disorder. He wanted Anna                    under his care, at St. John's. My parents were very poor, but he agreed to cover all the hospital costs... In                   less than five months, Dr. Kane had cured Anna. It was unbelievable. She was her old self again. A real miracle of science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know? She died there with                     all of Kane's other patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben takes the old release form out of his pocket and show Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna left the hospital two days before                  the massacre. Kane changed the records                  to make her disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a journalist, are you? What                  do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know. After St. John's,                       where did she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stares at Ben, unsure of saying what he's about to to this perfect stranger-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna came back to live with us for a while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a while?                                              Robert lowers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after? Why did she leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... Because strange things                         started to happen in the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Anna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not with Anna... The old man obviously doesn't want to get into the detail memories are too painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the mirrors? Robert stiffens, eyeing Ben with a dark look- How does he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Esseker, tell me where I can find your sister. It's very important. It's                    a matter of life and death.                               Robert hesitates -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he died, Kane sent us a letter                     asking us to keep Anna away from mirrors and that whatever happens she                     should be in a place where the mirrors                    could never find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect us, she left the house and                     joined the monastic orders, where mirrors are forbidden... St. Augustine's                  monastery, on the road to Midwich.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: Ben's car does a one-eighty turn in front of the farmhous heading back to the main road.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Standing on the porch, with an anxious look on his face, watches him disappear in the distance. He sits down on the steps, and wipes his glasses. The crows fly low in the sky- It's a bad sign.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: The nuns come and go under the arches of the monastic cou A deadly silence prevails over the monastery, where time to stand still. All these women have taken vows of povert obedience and chastity to serve god. On the other side of the cloister wall, a small winding r zigzags between the pine trees. Ben's car draws nearer. H in front of the entrance to the monastery.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: Ben pushes open the heavy front door. The place is dark a silent. He goes to the front desk- Behind a wooden screen he can barely make out the two nun charge of admissions. They are the only nuns granted expo the outside world. For the rest, physical and visual cont strictly prohibited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, how can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Sister. I have come to visit a member of your community... Sister Anna?                  Her real name is Anna Esseker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she expecting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a relative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Sister, I must see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are not listed, I cannot help you sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have strict regulations concerning visitations, which are exclusively for family members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, tell her that I came all the way from New York and that I work with Dr. Kane at St. John's Hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up and escapes through one of the back doors. The other nun behind the screen, observes Ben with curios Time goes by, and Ben grows impatient.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: Inside the house in Jersey, Amy has isolated herself with kids in the parent's bedroom. She's reading them a bedtim story. Even if all the windows, screens, and TV are covered by newspapers or painting, Amy acts in front of Daisy and Mi as if nothing has happened. In the rest of the house, everything has been meticulousl covered, wrapped, painted or reversed. Still, here and th barely audible rustle pierces through the silence- In the children's room, the paint covering the mirror slo begins to flake off... The newspaper wrapped around the windowpanes begins to ri

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAY
dialogues.text: Ben is losing his calm. Time is running out. The nun reap behind the wooden screen-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Anna has agreed to talk to you, you may proceed to the parlor next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben crosses the hall and opens the door that the nun gest him to. He enters the parlor alone. In the spare room, a chair st a wooden screen, fencing him off, once again.

dialogues.speaker: 107A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind the screen, a silhouette awaits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. John's closed down in 1952. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sits down. Even at a short distance he cannot discern face of Anna Esseker, who is now Sister Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Benjamin Carson. I work as                   a night watchman at 1229 West 38th                      Street in New York City, what used to be St. John's Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want Mr. Carson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My help? I don't quite see how I could possibly be of any help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife and children are in danger.                     What is threatening my family is                        asking for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a split second, Ben makes eye contact with Anna behin screen. She has understood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't help me I may lose the only thing that matters to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot leave the precincts. It's                      impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me why are the mirrors from the old hospital so determined to find you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Anna remains silent-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must know, Sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not the wish of the mirrors to find me, but of what is imprisoned inside them. The mirrors are merely windows on our world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window... For what? For whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the time that I was at St. John's,                   Dr. Kane's therapy for personality                      disorders consisted of locking the                      patient up in a mirrored room for                       several days on end, in order to force him to confront his own image. I spent                  the darkest days of my life in that room. On the 6th day the nurses found me lifeless, almost dead. Since that                    day, I have never had another fit. But deep down inside I've always known the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no cure for schizophrenia, it was something else, Mr. Carson. And                     whatever it was, it entered the mirror.                                                 We can feel the emotion in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that after fifty years, this would have all gone away. They would have disappeared from the mirrors. I didn't know.... I'm sorry but if I                      agree to go with you and return to that place, I will make it possible for them to cross the threshold back into the real world.                                    Everything is now making sense for Ben-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It entered with you and they need you                   to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The consequences of such an act, Mr.                    Carson, would be more devastating than                  letting them suffer where they are                      now. I'm going to pray for you and                      your family. That's all I can do right now, Mr. Carson. God bless you...                       She stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... Please, listen to me- Terence                    Berry, Gary Lewis and many others                        before me... Those are the people who                    died trying to find you. Because they failed, their families died too. My                      sister was murdered two days ago... My                   wife and kids will next if you don't                     come with me. Look- From his wallet Ben takes out a wrinkled photograph of Mi as a baby, in Amy's arms. Daisy stands next to them in th picture. Ben presses the photograph against the grating f to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife and two children. They're all I've got. They're innocent... Please.                    Anna stays quiet a moment behind the screen and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ON YOUR TIME
dialogues.text: Anna doesn't respond and disappears in the distance. Ben failed. He's desperate and lost. He has a hard time containing his anger.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: On the horizon, a red sun sets behind the treetops. It's nightfall. The bells from the monastery begin to toll. The cross above the monastery reflects upside down in a p of rain water. Frustrated, Ben walks back to his car and dials his home on his cell phone -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the lights of Manhattan sparkle in the n In the house, all the lights are off. All is quiet, too quiet.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the hallway, the shiny doorknob leading to Amy's bedro the only reflecting surface that has been forgotten. In the distorted reflection, we see Michael's silhouette approaching. The little boy reaches for the knob but-

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Inside the bedroom, Amy fell asleep with Daisy in her arm On the bedside table, THE HOME PHONE STARTS RINGING- She up with a jolt and picks up the cordless receiver-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Ben... Where are you? Did you find her? Did you talk to... She stops speaking as she realizes- Daisy is asleep next but MICHAEL IS NO LONGER THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael? MICHAEL!? (on the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hold on, Michael is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben on the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I fell asleep with the kids on the bed and... She sees that THE BEDROOM DOOR IS HALF OPENED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael? The sound of pouring water is heard, coming from the hall Michael must be in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, what's going on? Are you alright? Amy runs to the door, waking Daisy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her daughter) You stay right here sweetheart, I'm going to look for your brother. Stay                    right here. (to Ben on the phone)                               Ben, I have to call you back, I have                    to find Michael...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Amy, stay with me...

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Amy comes out of the bedroom and notices that the floor i completely soaked. She turns on the light in the hallway, only to discover- The entire upper floor is covered by an inch of water- al taps in the bathroom are turned on and have transformed t surface of the floor into A LARGE NATURAL MIRROR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben on the phone) Fuck! There is water everywhere...                      Michael? Michael? MICHAEL?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy freezes when she realizes that all the picture frames all the mirrors in the corridor have been scraped, bringi reflecting surfaces, once again, to the light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)                                            Ben, someone scraped all the mirrors... There is someone in the                      house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) I don't know where he is. I don't see                   him. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she turns in the hallway, Amy sees A DARK SHADOW MOVIN ONE OF THE MIRRORS. Terrified, she steps back and hits th opposite wall. She drops the phone on the flooded floor-

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: At the same moment, Ben, still outside of the monastery, off in his conversation with his wife-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy? Amy? Answer me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to redial but that doesn't work. He knows someth weird is happening there. Without hesitation, Ben grabs his gun inside the car and back towards the monastery gates.

dialogues.speaker: 109B -BACK IN THE HOUSE-
dialogues.text: Unsure of what she saw, Amy makes a step towards the mirr only finds her own reflection. She picks up the phone- The water shorted it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, Amy walks up to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door- the sink and bathtub are filled with overflowing onto the tiled floor. Michael is not there.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A hand enters frame to light some candles. Sister Anna is back in her cell. The way her hand shakes carries the match from one candle to the other betrays ho she is by the confrontation with Ben- It's been too much that she's carrying the guilt. She runs the rosary nervously between her fingers and kne down in front of her bed to pray when- A loud muted sound followed by a sudden wave of agitation heard outside the cell. Someone has broken into the monas She recognizes Ben's voice- Like a mad man, he's looking everywhere and threatens the other nuns to show him the w Anna stands up when Ben bursts into her cell with his gun hand. Behind him, the other nuns are terrified. Ben points the gun at Anna-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids are not going to die tonight.                   You're coming with me, now.

dialogues.speaker: 109C CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Not intimidated by the weapon, Anna steps towards Ben. FO FIRST TIME, BEN CAN SEE HER FACE- The old lady seems more determined than ever-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I come with you Mr. Carson, you                      have to promise to do everything I tell you. My way. No questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben lowers his gun-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy waits patiently in the bed following her mother's instructions. Suddenly she hears her mother calling her f children's bedroom-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy... Daisy... Come here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy steps into the corridor and stops, for a moment, wh notices the flooding. She enters her bedroom, following t voice that calls out for her-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy... Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Daisy explores the bedroom. The voice is still calling, b mother is not there. The door shuts behind her. She walks up to the mirror on the wall. The paint has bee partially scraped off-

dialogues.speaker: BUT IN REALITY, AMY IS STILL IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: She turns off the tap and sinks her hand into the depths bathtub to pull the plug, when she sees Michael's reflect the surface -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, but Michael is not behind her. The refl lied. SUDDENLY HER ARM IS PULLED INTO THE BATHTUB.

dialogues.speaker: -BACK IN THE CHILDREN'S BEDROOM-
dialogues.text: Daisy walks up to her mother's reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come sweetheart... Come, come closer... Come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy is mistrustful. She senses that something is not ri the mirror, her mother's attitude is different and strang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in there, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come closer, don't worry... Everything is all right, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
